dict.string: Bubbles are fun, but what I really want to teach you about are notes. If you want to grow up and play the piano, the violin, or guitar, you have to learn to read notes. But don't worry, it's really easy!
This is called a staff. This is where all the notes will go.
Notes are those funny black circles with tails. They can go on the lines like this…
Do you remember your ABC's? Because that's how we remember which clam to play when you see a note. Each clam has it's own letter, see?
The first note we’re going to learn is a Low C. It looks this.
It has that line through it. Try playing it!
The next note is a D, and then an E. Try them.
Good job! Next are F and G. Go for it!
Wow! You’re on a roll. Now we go back to A, B, and C.
Don't worry, I have trouble remembering everything too. I think of all the notes on the lines like 'Every Good Boy Does Fine'. You can try playing the first three.
And for the notes in spaces, I think of 'FACE'. Like your face or my face. Try playing the first three.
Well done! I think you're getting the hang of this. Remember, in note mode, you can turn on help from the menu, but you won't earn any badges if you have it on! Goodbye for now.
